body:
Your merge commit only has one parent, and doesn't actually merge anything. I suspect this is actually therapist's fault. I've seen this before but haven't been able to figure out exactly what is going on to file it.

I'd undo that commit (`git reset --hard 06d7349`), re-fetch everything (`git fetch --all`) and then try the merge again, this time stopping Therapist from running (`git merge upstream/master --no-verify`, assuming your mozilla remote is named upstream).

body_html:
Your merge commit only has one parent, and doesn't actually merge anything. I suspect this is actually therapist's fault. I've seen this before but haven't been able to figure out exactly what is going on to file it.

I'd undo that commit (git reset --hard 06d7349), re-fetch everything (git fetch --all) and then try the merge again, this time stopping Therapist from running (git merge upstream/master --no-verify, assuming your mozilla remote is named upstream).
